page.title: 01 General Description
page.content: The area is{totally agricultural},with the majority of the farming being dairy,although there has been a recent move towards more grain growing -oil seed rape being the latest innovation. Some farms belong to the Duchy,which means they are quite small as are the rest of the farms in this area. People live in{small villages } (largest Kestle Mill).The houses are old with little modern development. As in much of Cornwall the most notable features are connected with tourism.{Dairyland}is a working farm and museum,while{Trerice Manor}(owned by the National Trust) is a house of historic significance.Both are open to the public. The area is largely{unspoilt}with little evidence of pollution or the effects of man other than small scale farming.
